titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Gary Stevenson Papers WAG.182
titlestmt.author: Rachel Schimke and Daniel Michelson, October 2011

publicationstmt.publisher: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2022-12-12 19:34:54 -0500.

repository.corpname: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives

did.unittitle: Gary Stevenson Papers
did.physloc: Materials are stored offsite and advance notice is required for use. Please contact tamiment.wagner@nyu.edu at least two business days prior to research visit.
did.abstract: Gary Stevenson served as an organizer and business agent for the International Brotherhood of Teamsters (IBT), Local 810, from 1977 to 1987. Local 810 represents laborers in New York, New Jersey, Connecticut, and Pennsylvania who work in a variety of occupations, including truck drivers, metal and machine shop workers, and lab and manufacturing technicians. The collection contains files related to the organizing efforts and other activities of the International Brotherhood of Teamsters (IBT) from the 1960s to the 1990s.

bioghist.head: Historical/Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Gary Stevenson served as an organizer and business agent for the International Brotherhood of Teamsters (IBT), Local 810, from 1977 to 1987. Local 810 represents laborers in New York, New Jersey, Connecticut, and Pennsylvania who work in a variety of occupations, including truck drivers, metal and machine shop workers, and lab and manufacturing technicians. Stevenson's duties for Local 810 included executing organizing campaigns, handling grievances, and negotiating contracts between union members and their employers. He later worked for the IBT in a broader capacity, serving as the union's Eastern Region Organizing Coordinator.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection has not been arranged by an archivist. The materials are arranged in the order in which they were received from the donor.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: The collection contains files related to the organizing efforts and other activities of the International Brotherhood of Teamsters (IBT) from the 1960s to the 1990s. The work of Local 810 in New York and New Jersey makes up a significant portion of the collection. To a lesser extent, the collection also includes information on the activities of the Teamsters for a Democratic Union-Professional Drivers Council (TDU-PROD) and other labor unions, as well as other local IBT unions.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: The provenance of this collection is unknown. The accession number associated with this collection is 1950.102.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Published citations should take the following form:
Identification of item, date; Gary Stevenson Papers; WAG 182; Box number; Folder number; Tamiment Library/Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives, New York University.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Archives has no information about copyright ownership for this collection and is not authorized to grant permission to publish or reproduce materials from it. Materials in this collection, which were created in 1948-1994, are expected to enter the public domain in 2115.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Materials were shifted between boxes to ensure that boxes were appropriately filled. Some materials in overstuffed folders were refoldered.
Inventory was done at the box level by the archivists. Description is provided at the folder level where folder titles were already available.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material at the Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives
relatedmaterial.p:
Researchers interested in the International Brotherhood of Teamsters may also wish to consult the following collections:
International Brotherhood of Teamsters Printed Ephemera Collection (PE 018)
Guide to the International Brotherhood of Teamsters, Local 282, FORE (Fear of Reprisal Ends) Records (WAG 107)
Robert Fitch Papers (WAG 261)

phystech.head: Audiovisual Access Policies and Procedures
phystech.p: Audiovisual materials have not been preserved and may not be available to researchers. Materials not yet digitized will need to have access copies made before they can be used. To request an access copy, or if you are unsure if an item has been digitized, please contact tamiment.wagner@nyu.edu, (212) 998-2630 with the collection name, collection number, and a description of the item(s) requested. A staff member will respond to you with further information.

phystech.head: Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements
phystech.p: Born-digital materials have not been transferred and may not be available to researchers. Researchers may request access copies. To request that material be transferred, or if you are unsure if material has been transferred, please contact tamiment.wagner@nyu.edu, (212) 998-2630 with the collection name, collection number, and a description of the item(s) requested. A staff member will respond to you with further information.
